meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Israel.
meanings.sent1: In Israel, people use shekalim to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I paid for my groceries with shekalim at the market.
meanings.sent3: The shekalim in my pocket jingled as I walked.
meanings.sent4: Her generosity was worth more than all the shekalim in the world.
meanings.sent5: The shiny shekalim sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to about 11.4 grams.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler measured the gold in shekalim to determine its value.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for two shekalim of flour.
meanings.sent3: The shekalim on the scale seemed to tip the balance.
meanings.sent4: Her words carried the emotional shekalim of a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The shekalim felt light as a feather in his hand.

meanings.definition: A coin used in ancient Israel.
meanings.sent1: Archaeologists found ancient shekalim buried in the ruins.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a collection of old shekalim.
meanings.sent3: The shekalim rolled across the table like tiny wheels.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty was not for sale, not even for a shekel of shekalim.
meanings.sent5: The ancient shekalim told stories of a bygone era.
